basics.name: John Doe
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: +5 years of experience in software development, focusing on delivering scalable and efficient solutions to complex problems.
basics.about:
In 2010, I began my journey into software development, driven by curiosity and a passion for problem-solving. By 2015, I had launched my first project: a scheduling tool for a local business. Since then, I've collaborated with various industries, including education, healthcare, e-commerce, and logistics, delivering innovative solutions tailored to each unique challenge.

My expertise ranges from crafting intuitive frontend designs to developing robust backend systems. Currently, I focus on full-stack development, excelling in building scalable and maintainable applications. Noteworthy milestones include spearheading a digital transformation initiative for a mid-sized company and mentoring junior developers to foster team growth and technical excellence.

When Iâ€™m not coding, I enjoy exploring new hiking trails, experimenting with photography, or attending community hackathons. I also actively contribute to open-source projects and continuously seek opportunities to learn and grow in the ever-evolving tech landscape.

work.name: TechCorp
work.summary: Led the backend team, optimizing system performance and ensuring high availability for enterprise applications. Collaborated with stakeholders to align technical goals with business objectives.

work.name: CodeStudio
work.summary: Developed and maintained web applications, focusing on user experience and system reliability. Worked closely with designers and QA teams to ensure seamless product launches.

footer: Based on the design of Brittany Chiang, this SPA is built with the Quasar Framework. All text is set in the Inter typeface.
